meanings.sent1: The subecho of her laughter filled the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard a subecho of my own voice bouncing off the walls.
meanings.sent3: The subecho of the music made it sound like a distant memory.
meanings.sent4: His words had a subecho, lingering in the air long after he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The subecho of the thunder made the storm feel even more powerful.

meanings.sent1: The sound seemed to subecho through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent2: Her voice would subecho in the vast cave, creating an eerie effect.
meanings.sent3: The laughter from the party would subecho in the quiet street outside.
meanings.sent4: His footsteps subechoed in the empty building, giving him a sense of unease.
meanings.sent5: The music subechoed softly in the background, adding to the peaceful atmosphere.
